intro: Verticordia pentandra, commonly known as the yellow spider orchid, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spider-like inflorescence and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to the region's Mediterranean climate. It is a member of the family Diaportaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a vulnerable species.
